memberdef.argsstring: (sim_offload_data *sim, int input_active, real **B_offload_array, real **E_offload_array, real **plasma_offload_array, real **neutral_offload_array, real **wall_offload_array, int **wall_int_offload_array, real **boozer_offload_array, real **mhd_offload_array, real **asigma_offload_array, real **nbi_offload_array, input_particle **p, int *n_markers)
memberdef.name: hdf5_interface_read_input

detaileddescription.para: This function reads input from HDF5 file, initializes it, and allocates offload arrays and returns the pointers to them.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to simulation offload struct
bitflags for input types to read
pointer to magnetic field offload array
pointer to electric field offload array
pointer to plasma data offload array
pointer to neutral data offload array
pointer to wall offload array
pointer to wall integer offload array
pointer to boozer offload array
pointer to mhd offload array
pointer to atomic offload array
pointer to neutral beam injector data offload array
pointer to marker offload data
pointer to integer notating how many markers were read

simplesect.para: zero if reading and initialization succeeded

detaileddescription.para: This functions creates results group (if one does not already exist) and creates run group corresponding to this run. Run group is named as /results/<run>_XXXXXXXXXX/ where X's are the qid of current run and <run> is the type of the run: "run" for ascot5_main and "bbnbi" for bbnbi5.
The group is initialized by writing qids of all used inputs as string attributes in the run group. Also the date and empty "details" fields are written.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to simulation offload struct
qid of this run
type of this run

briefdescription.para: Write marker state to HDF5 output.

parameterdescription.para: HDF5 output filename
name of the state to be written
number of markers in marker array
array of markers to be written

simplesect.para: Zero if state was written succesfully

parameterdescription.para: pointer to simulation offload data
diagnostics offload array
HDF5 output filename

simplesect.para: Zero if diagnostics were written succesfully

briefdescription.para: Fetch active qid within the given group.

detaileddescription.para: Each input group (/bfield/, /options/, etc.) has qid string indicating which of the subgroups is active, i.e., meant to be used within this simulation.
This function fetches the active qid assuming the file is opened and closed outside of this function.

parameterdescription.para: HDF5 file identifier
group string including the "/"s on both sides e.g. /bfield/
array where qid will be stored

briefdescription.para: Generate an identification number for a run.

detaileddescription.para: The identification number (QID) is a 32 bit unsigned integer represented in a string format, i.e., by ten characters. QID is a random integer between 0 and 4 294 967 295, and it is padded with leading zeroes in string representation.

parameterdescription.para: a pointer to 11 chars wide array where generated QID is stored

briefdescription.para: HDF5 operations are accessed through here.

detaileddescription.para: This module handles IO operations to HDF5 file. Accessing HDF5 files from the main program should be done using this module.
